elements.name: vaadin-avatar-group
elements.description:
`<vaadin-avatar-group>` is a Web Component providing avatar group displaying functionality.

To create the avatar group, first add the component to the page:

```
<vaadin-avatar-group></vaadin-avatar-group>
```

And then use [`items`](https://cdn.vaadin.com/vaadin-web-components/23.2.0/#/elements/vaadin-avatar-group#property-items) property to initialize the structure:

```
document.querySelector('vaadin-avatar-group').items = [
  {name: 'John Doe'},
  {abbr: 'AB'}
];
```

### Styling

The following shadow DOM parts are exposed for styling:

Part name   | Description
----------- | ---------------
`container` | The container element
`avatar`    | Individual avatars

See [Styling Components](https://vaadin.com/docs/latest/styling/custom-theme/styling-components) documentation.

### Internal components

In addition to `<vaadin-avatar-group>` itself, the following internal
components are themable:

- `<vaadin-avatar-group-list-box>` - has the same API as [`<vaadin-list-box>`](https://cdn.vaadin.com/vaadin-web-components/23.2.0/#/elements/vaadin-list-box).
- `<vaadin-avatar-group-overlay>` - has the same API as [`<vaadin-overlay>`](https://cdn.vaadin.com/vaadin-web-components/23.2.0/#/elements/vaadin-overlay).

attributes.name: max-items-visible
attributes.description:
The maximum number of avatars to display. By default, all the avatars are displayed.
When _maxItemsVisible_ is set, the overflowing avatars are grouped into one avatar with
a dropdown. Setting 0 or 1 has no effect so there are always at least two avatars visible.

attributes.name: theme
attributes.description: The theme variants to apply to the component.

properties.name: items
maxItemsVisible
properties.description:
The maximum number of avatars to display. By default, all the avatars are displayed.
When _maxItemsVisible_ is set, the overflowing avatars are grouped into one avatar with
a dropdown. Setting 0 or 1 has no effect so there are always at least two avatars visible.
